7318624417215.name: Rookie Warrior
7318624417215.summary: Heavy armor set for a rookie warrior, for CBBE 3BA, BHUNP, and HIMBO
7318624417215.description:
There are seven modular pieces: the chestplate, the gambeson, pants, poleyns, boots, bracers, and gloves.

For the gambeson and the pants, there are six color variants that you can mix and match. I think black and red looks pretty good.

For 3BA and BHUNP, the gambeson has two versions, one with physics enables and one which does not, the non physics one is for wearing with the chestplate, or if you just enjoy no physics. The boots also come in high heels or regular boots for women.

The chestplate does not jiggle, this is by design.

Requirements:

CBBE 3BA or BHUNPv4 or HIMBO

Bodyslide

Racemenu

esl flagged esp. Use additemmenu, or craft and also temper with steel smithing perk because I found an xedit script that does this for me.

Build with bodyslide first.

7318624415310.name: Black Rose
7318624415310.summary: n8k's somewhat unreasonably revealing clothing set. Refreshed for 3BA, BHUNPv4, and HIMBO
7318624415310.description:
My reworked version of the Black Rose set originally by n8k for Oldrim. Previous conversions to SSE have all just coped with the issues with the meshes, which I have tried to address here. Let's say this is Black Rose Refreshed? This is a direct conversion from the [original UNPB mod page ](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/46580)from n8k.

Pieces separated out for mix and match enthuiasts. 

The original meshes were fried in terms of polygons and normals (the heels normals were inside out for some reason), so I did some blender work to fix it up and subdivide the pieces so they have more than 20 polygons each, and a lot of small manual mesh edits. They should be less blocky now and generally have less jarring angular shapes. This is not perfect, of course, but it should at least go from 2013 to maybe 2018.

SMP physics has been added to the dangly bits like the rings and the belt ends. On the textures side, the lace textures have been improved, and there are also two new recolors in the usual colors of roses - red and white.

There are hand painted weights for immersive physics, with special thanks to [PsychoWedge](https://next.nexusmods.com/profile/PsychoWedge) for doing the BHUNP weight painting. 

Also, some custom sliders that I will leave as an exercise for the reader to find out what they do.

﻿![Image](https://i.imgur.com/gLNfhTJ.png)﻿

These things all have SMP now, yay!

esl flagged esp. Use [additemmenu](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/17563), [modex](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/137877), or [console](https://elderscrolls.fandom.com/wiki/Console_Commands_(Skyrim)); no crafting recipes. [Build with bodyslide ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=45E8qqnqJDQ)first.

Requirements:

CBBE 3BA or BHUNPv4

Bodyslide

FSMP﻿

Racemenu

Optionally, if you have heels sounds and [sound records distributor](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/77815), the heels will have heel footstep sounds.

7318624395023.name: Simple Nail Polish - Brighter Colors Patch
7318624395023.summary: Patch for Simple Nail Polish by CallMeMoon to add white and brighter colored nail polish overlay options
7318624395023.description:
This is just a simple texture and script change to add white and brighter colored nail polish options to the [Simple Nail Polish ](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/108077)mod.

The original textures are too dark for lighter and brighter colored Racemenu hues, since the hues act as a tint layer over the texture, so I adjusted the textures to be lighter and saved them to separate files. The script has also been adjusted so now there are light and dark options for each overlay. 

Requires the original mod and all of its requirements.

7318624415375.name: Ancient imperial armor but there is SMP now
7318624415375.summary: Adds SMP cloth physics for 4thUnknown's ancient imperial armor
7318624415375.description:
I started putting this together before I realized this is a pain in the ass. The close vicinity of the metal plate on the right thigh makes me want to cry. Also the fact that there are two separate pieces that are supposed to move independently of each other in the front and back and they are so close together.

This adds SMP to the chainmail skirt, the three leather flaps in the front and back, the two dangly cloth pieces on the chest, and the hanging bit of leather on the back of the armor.

This mostly works but there's a lot of subtle clipping just because all the meshes are so close together, it's practically impossible to fix all of it.

Someone else can feel free to carry on the torch and make it better if they want?

These are bodyslide files using [urbon's conversion ](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/142700)as the base for HIMBO and BHUNP; [pentapox ](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/142702)for 3BA. Get the rest of the bodyslide files for gloves and boots there if you'd like.

Requires the original mod, bodyslide, and some modding acumen like knowing how to install FSMP and everything related to it. This just provides the bodyslide files, rigged and weighted meshes, and the xml.

7318624414675.name: Elvenia Armor
7318624414675.summary: Elvenia armor set originally by gutris1 reworked for 3BA and BHUNPv4 with custom textures and new pieces
7318624414675.description:
My version of the Elvenia armor set originally by [gutris1](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/80615). Shall we call this Elvenia 2025?

Specific changes:

Pieces separated out so they can be equipped and unequipped separately, some new pieces created from the same assets, added SMP to the belly tassels thing, and a variety of zap sliders and adjustment sliders. The pieces that you'd expect to have physics all have SMP physics now, yay!

This is partially based on kahvipannu84's 3BA version with squeeze sliders and weights, so this inherits all of the changes made there along with the original SE Kalessin42 3BA version that it's based on. Here I made some more uv, weights, and slider changes of my own, made some new pieces with the assets, and also brought those features to BHUNP because the cult of BHUNP graciously tests and takes screenshots for me.

This version also uses custom textures from xavbio instead of the vanilla elven armor textures. See credits.

This version is standalone thanks to the permissions of the previous iterations of this outfit. 

esl flagged esp. Use additemmenu, or there are actually crafting recipes this time as well that requires elven smithing. Build with bodyslide first.

CBBE 3BA or BHUNPv4

7318624414407.description:
I was asked by [Nuascura ](https://next.nexusmods.com/profile/Nuascura)last year to take over [this old outfit](https://www.loverslab.com/files/file/5387-martha-wayne-outfit-sultry-shawls-rev). I said I will do it later - a wizard is never late or early, so I totally did not just forget about this until a couple months later. I am not the hero SSE deserves or needs, I just convert obscure old outfits badly.

Aside from modernizing the bodyslide files to 3BA and BHUNP v4 alongside other stuff like converting to form 44, NiOverride heels instead of HDT, I also gave it some touch ups like using texturesets to save on mesh space, and added a couple of retexture colors. There are four colors for the dress, three for the fur jacket, two for the heels. 

If you have sound record distributor and heels sounds, the heels will have heels sounds.

esl flagged esp. Use additemmenu. Build with bodyslide first. No crafting recipes.

7318624414228.name: The Last Vampire Hunter CBBE 3BA
7318624414228.summary: CBBE 3BA bodyslide conversions for hyruledm's the last vampire hunter with my opinionated changes
7318624414228.description:
A port of a port! 

Some additional changes I made to my own taste:

SMP parameter adjustments. I made the cloth weightier, so they are flappier than the original. 

I also separated out the sash/tie thing into its own mesh and gave it SMP bones.

I did ~~not~~ convert the chest belt piece, because weight painting and manually adjusting all the sliders was driving me crazy - someone please do this? *I did this, it was a pain in the ass. It doesn't work very well but you get what you get*

Requires the original [mod ](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/141426)for textures and esp. You will also need SMP.

Step by step guide:

[list=1]

* Download the original BHUNP mod for assets and esp

* Download SMP if you haven't

* Download the bodyslide files here

* Build bodyslide files

* yay! you did it

![Image](https://i.imgur.com/NAEELTf.png)

7318624403844.name: See La Mer
7318624403844.summary: Beach and ocean themed See La Mer outfit set converted from Oldrim UNPB to CBBE 3BA and BHUNP with SMP.
7318624403844.description:
I found this set in an Oldrim armor compilations pack for CBBE. Based on what I could find I believe this was first attributed to Melodic for Oldrim UNPB and 7B. I updated it for SSE 3BA and BHUNP with some of my own changes.

Added SMP to the cloth pieces, and repainted the bra shell pieces bone weights to be rigid with more realistic physic behavior. Also added gold and purple recolors.

No need to tell me about missing textures in bodyslide, they will show up in game correctly, just trust.

7318624402058.summary: Egyptian themed outfit converted from Oblivion with additional pieces created for CBBE 3BA, BHUNP and UBE

I don't know why this set is called dragon song, it seems to be Egyptian themed and there are no dragons there. From what I can find it seems like it was originally made for Oblivion by **[GSBmodders](https://www.loverslab.com/profile/190-gsbmodders/)**         

Outfit includes separate pieces for: forearm, upper arm, necklace, chest, waist ring, belly piercing, panty, thigh, calves, feet.

7318624401789.description:
This is an old Oblivion mod.

I upscaled the textures to 2K/4K, added some recolor options for the veil, added bodyslide zap and adjustment sliders, and added SMP to the veil.

7318624401223.name: Hkx Conversion Tool
7318624401223.summary: Windows GUI program for converting hkx files between Skyrim SE/LE formats and XML for modding
7318624401223.description:
HKX Conversion Tool

HKX Conversion Tool is a GUI wrapper for [serde-hkx ](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/126214)for converting Havok files between different formats for Skyrim modding.

I initially started building a wrapper for [hkxcmd](https://github.com/figment/hkxcmd), but since that doesn't handle amd64 hkx files, I was also using [hkxconv ](https://github.com/ret2end/hkxconv)to convert those into xmls first and pushing those xmls through hkxcmd, and then I got upset that the solution was messy and started to look at their source code to try and build a modern version that handles win32, amd64 and xml format conversions between each other. Thankfully I didn't get too far into reinventing the wheel before I found out someone built this already, so I just repurposed the GUI tool for their CLI since It Just Works™.

Working with havok files is really a pain in the ass, since Blender's hkx plugin can't import Skyrim SE/amd64 hkx formats, they have to all be converted to win32 Oldrim format first. A lot of the existing guides will tell you to find and install Havok Content Tools and use hctStandAloneFilterManager.exe. It annoyed me a lot that the animation modding toolchain basically relies on an obsolete and unsupported tool that you have to find a download for on some google drive folder.

Maybe someone will also reimplement hkanno to not rely on HCT and just work off of xml for annotations editing, then animating and animation modding in 2024 wouldn't be excruciatingly tedious for anyone that has to work with existing animations.

Features

* Convert HKX files to XML format and between formats for Skyrim LE and SE

* Convert XML files to HKX format for Skyrim LE and SE

* Batch conversion support

* User-friendlier GUI interface

* Specify output folder and suffix options

Installation

[list=1]

* Download the latest release.

* Extract the zip file to your desired location.

* Run hkxtools.exe file.

Usage

[list=1]

* Launch the application.

* Click "Browse Input Files" to select the HKX or XML files you want to convert.

* (Optional) Set the output folder by clicking "Browse" next to "Output Folder".

* (Optional) Enter a suffix for the output files.

* Select the desired output format (XML, Skyrim LE, or Skyrim SE).

* Click "Run Conversion" to start the conversion process.

7318624401010.name: 3D Female Pubic Hair
7318624401010.summary: Adds 43 mesh-based pubic hair options for CBBE 3BA BHUNP, and UBE female characters applied through TNG. Matches hair color.
7318624401010.description:
Adds 43 mesh-based pubic hairstyles for female characters applied through [TNG](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/104215). (rudimentary SoS patch now available, maybe someone will make a patch with full MCM support) 

Matches the color of the character's hair through [Hair Colour Sync](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/121751). Non-AE users try [Sync Wig Hair Color](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/48311?tab=description).

Requires TNG distribution and either CBBE 3BA or BHUNP.

Some options contain a lot of polygons and might impact performance. For people on modern computers as long as you don't have 30 naked characters in a single room it should probably be fine since it will normally be hidden on clothed characters.

It would probably be a lot more practical to use hair cards and textures instead of having individual hair strands, but I don't know how to do that so this is what you will get.

Bodyslide files for CBBE 3BA are included in the main files. BHUNP and UBE bodyslides available in optional files. No prebuilt meshes, batch building meshes required before use.

7318624396992.name: Professional Dancer
7318624396992.summary: Adds a dance spell and 10 dance animations. Draw a crowd and get tipped.
7318624396992.description:
Become a professional dancer. This adds a dance spell and 13 dance animations, dancing draws a crowd of NPCs who will tip you for your performance.

You will be given a dance power in the shouts tab. Activate to start dancing, activate again to stop. Dances are chosen by you via message box.

Dances 1-10 are professional dances.

Dances 11, 12 and 13 are vanilla dances (made famous by Cicero).

Dance 14 is a vanilla cheering animation (music track and tipping are forcefully disabled for Dance 14).

**Customization**

From version 1.3, you can customize the mod in MCM.

Customization via console commands:

<details><summary>Spoiler</summary>

 

**Enabling/disabling a dance from showing up in the message boxes

**[spoiler]

[code]﻿set bAllowDance1 to 0

[/code]to disable a certain dance.

[code]﻿set bAllowDance1 to 1

[/code]to enable it back.

By default, all 14 Dances are enabled. The dance names are Dance1, Dance2 ... Dance14.

</details>

**Enabling/disabling the audience **from gathering and reacting to your performance

<details><summary>Spoiler</summary>

[code]﻿set bDanceAudienceEnabled to 0

[/code]to disable audience reaction.

[code]﻿set bDanceAudienceEnabled to 1

[/code]to enable it back.

Enabled by default.

</details>

**Enabling/disabling music playing **(drum track) while you dance

<details><summary>Spoiler</summary>

[code]﻿set bDanceMusicEnabled to 0

[/code]to disable the drum track.

[code]﻿set bDanceMusicEnabled to 1

[/code]to enable it back.

Enabled by default.

</details>

**Enabling/disabling notifications **on the dance being performed, tips earned etc.

<details><summary>Spoiler</summary>

[code]﻿set bDanceEnableNotifications to 0

[/code]to disable notifications.

[code]﻿set bDanceEnableNotifications to 1

[/code]to enable them back.

Enabled by default.

</details>

**Enabling/disabling the tipping mechanic** (audience will tip you while you dance)

<details><summary>Spoiler</summary>

[code]﻿set bDanceTippingEnabled to 0

[/code]to disable tips.

[code]﻿set bDanceTippingEnabled to 1

[/code]to enable them back.

Enabled by default.

</details>

**Enabling/disabling getting all the tips AFTER you're done dancing

**<details><summary>Spoiler</summary>

[code]﻿set bDanceTippingAfterPerformance to 0

[/code]to disable getting the tips after the dance is over.

[code]﻿set bDanceTippingAfterPerformance to 1

[/code]to enable it.

**Disabled** by default.

</details>

**Setting the smallest single tip (in septims) you can get **(during the dance, you get multiple tips)

<details><summary>Spoiler</summary>

[code]﻿set fDanceMinGoldAmount to x

[/code]to set a minimum single tip, where x is a number.

Default is 1.

</details>

**Setting the largest single tip [b](in septims)** you can get

[/b]<details><summary>Spoiler</summary>

[code]﻿set fDanceMaxGoldAmount to x

[/code]to set a maximum single tip, where x is a number.

Default is 2.

</details>

**Setting the multiplier for a single tip **(a random value between the min and max amount gets multiplied by this)

<details><summary>Spoiler</summary>

[code]﻿set fDanceTippingEarnedMult to x

[/code]to set the multiplier, where x is a number.

Default is 1.

</details>[/spoiler]

**Installation**

Run FNIS/Nemesis/Pandora after installation.

Some previews [here](https://imgur.com/a/6yfhbpW)

7318624396333.name: Gunslicer Animations All in One OAR
7318624396333.summary: Gunslicer's animation replacers configured for OAR and bundled into a modular fomod installer. Includes adjusted varieties for some animations.
7318624396333.description:
This pack contains [Gunslicer's ](https://www.patreon.com/Gunslicer)﻿animation replacers configured for use with Open Animation Replacer. This replaces animations for the female character character.

On top of the original animations by Gunslicer, there are some OAR config changes to improve condition triggers as well as some subjectively improved variations of existing animations. Currently only weapons-sheathed sneak and two handed sneak have adjusted variations, but there may be more to come later.

fomod installer includes links to preview videos for some animations hosted on a [github pages site](https://gs-oar.github.io/gunslicer-oar/index.html), but so far it does not cover all of the animations currently included in the pack. Preview video submissions are welcomed as well as suggestions for OAR config changes or even animation changes if you wish to have them bundled in this pack, you can find guidelines on how to do so on the github repository readme [here](https://github.com/gs-oar/gunslicer-oar).

7318624395869.name: Hirosin Azur Lane Chen Hai Dress - My Version CBBE 3BA
7318624395869.summary: Chen Hai's outfit from Azur Lane by Hirosin for CBBE 3BA with my additions and adjustments
7318624395869.description:
Azur Lane Chen Hai outfit originally made by [Hirosin](https://arca.live/b/tullius/107249552), with my own edits. See below for the list of changes made:

> 1.0 changelog:

Outfit parts separated for modularity

Heels and feet meshes adjusted, original heel was too big for the size of the feet

SMP physics added to belly, hip and back tassels

SMP physics added to sleeves, static option also available since I'm not very happy with how it looks

Skirt SMP adjusted

Dress bodyslide redone with 3BA uniboob reference

Dress shader flag fixed so that racemenu overlays show up beneath transparent cloth

Normal map alpha increased to make things less reflective

There's two panty meshes in the original panty mesh file, they are slightly different so they've been separated out

Head accessory size adjusted to fit vanilla head instead of Tera Elin Race

Black color variant added

Various minor clipping fixes on collar, heels, gloves, and stockings

Bodyslide group added for quality of life

Ground meshes added, now you can drop the items on the floor and pick them back up again

Added various zap sliders

Two colors, black and white, with SMP dress and accessories. Transparency and lewd variants.

esl flagged esp. No prebuilt meshes, build with bodyslide and use additemmenu. No crafting recipes.

You will need [extended esl support](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/106441) if your game version is below 1.6.1130, racemenu for NiOverride heels, and FSMP for the dress.

7318624395498.name: Clothing Mod Esp Record Automation Script for Spriggit
7318624395498.summary: Provides Python based automation scripts for generating yaml files for clothing mods for converting into esp files using Spriggit
7318624395498.description:
Clothing Mod Esp Record Automation Script for Spriggit

Overview

This project provides an automation tool for generating yaml files for clothing mods for converting into esp files using [Spriggit](https://mutagen-modding.github.io/Spriggit/). The configuration and input data are specified in yaml files, and the tool handles the creation of necessary files and their conversion. This is primarily useful for outfit mods with multiple texture variants, as the scripts handle FormKey creation and naming for Armor, ArmorAddons and TextureSet records. 

In my own workflow this goes after I have created the bodyslide files with the meshes and processed the textures, since this also contains a helper script to automatically generate the input mesh name list for use here based on bodyslide .osp files. I made this for my own use because creating color variants for items is very time consuming and repetitive, but hopefully this will also save other people time.

Features

* Generate TextureSet, ArmorAddon, and Armor records in yaml format.

* Handles FormKey and EditorID creation and automatic renaming/renumbering, TextureSet texture map setting, AlternateTextures setting with 3D index and shape name inputs.

* Intended for converting generated yaml files into esp files using Spriggit.

* Inputs specified in inputs.yaml, settings configurable through config.yaml.

* Automatically infers body slots based on item names and sets appropriate slots, keywords, and values using configurable mappings.

Prerequisites

* Python 3.x and its standard libraries

* pyyaml

Setup

[list=1]

* Clone the repository to your local machine.

* Ensure you have Python 3.x installed.

* Install pyyaml.

* Configurate inputs.yaml to specify each clothing piece and texture variants.

* Run GenerateModFromInputs.py to generate yaml_output which will contain the files for Spriggit.

* Deserialize the yaml files back into an esp file with Spriggit.

* Open CK or SSEEdit and apply the esl flag, Spriggit doesn't handle number of records correctly yet so you will need to fix this manually.

Configuration

All configuration settings are stored in the config.yaml file. Below is an example configuration:

[code]spriggit_cli_path: "./Path/To/Spriggit.CLI.exe"

input_directory: "./yaml_output"

esp_name: "MyMod.esp"

mesh_output_dir: "./meshes/output"

texture_sets_dir: "./yaml_output/TextureSets"

armor_addons_dir: "./yaml_output/ArmorAddons"

armors_dir: "./yaml_output/Armors"

record_data_path: "./yaml_output/RecordData.yaml"

spriggit_meta_path: "./yaml_output/spriggit.meta"[/code]

Example inputs.yaml

This is the primary input file where you specify armor records in plain text which will get converted into yaml files and eventually esp. This is a lot faster than working in CreaitonKit or SSEEdit because you can copy and paste blocks and add name suffixes or change texture paths easily. A more detailed schema is included in the default inputs.yaml file.

I have also included a helper script ReadOspGenInputMeshes.py to generate the mesh_name_input list based on Bodyslide SliderSet folder contents. It will also provide you with a list of shapes for each mesh.

[code]mesh_name_input:

  - MultipleTextureMesh

  - SingleTextureMesh

texture_set_input:

  MultipleTextureMesh:

    Red:

      - Diffuse: "Path/To/Diffuse.dds"

        NormalOrGloss: "Path/To/Normal.dds"

        MeshName: "Mesh1"

        MeshIndex: 0

      - Diffuse: "Path/To/Diffuse2.dds"

        NormalOrGloss: "Path/To/Normal2.dds"

        MeshName: "Mesh2"

        MeshIndex: 1

    Blue:

      - Diffuse: "Path/To/BlueDiffuse.dds"

        NormalOrGloss: "Path/To/BlueNormal.dds"

        MeshName: "Mesh1"

        MeshIndex: 0

  SingleTextureMesh:

    Green:

      - Diffuse: "Path/To/GreenDiffuse.dds"

        NormalOrGloss: "Path/To/GreenNormal.dds"

        MeshName: "Mesh2"

        MeshIndex: 0

[/code]

Example maps.yaml

The maps.yaml file sets configs for automating the process of adding keywords, setting bodyslots, and setting value, weight and armor rating for each piece of clothing. This file contains mappings that directs the script to automatically infer body slot types based on item names and set the appropriate slots, keywords, and values. I have included a default config for this file that I use, a simple example to demonstrate the schema below:

[code]first_person_flags_map:

  Head: ["Helmet", "Hat"]

  Body: ["Armor", "Robe"]

keywords_map:

  Head: ["ArmorHelmet", "ClothingHead"] # Just for reference, you need to use the actual FormKeys of the keywords here

  Body: ["ArmorBody", "ClothingBody"]

armor_values_map:

  Head:

    Value: 100

    Weight: 1.0

    ArmorRating: 10

  Body:

    Value: 500

    Weight: 5.0

    ArmorRating: 50

[/code]

Project Structure

[code]├── config.yaml              # Config file

├── ModGenClass.py           # Contains the class object for parsing config and input yamls

├── ReadOspGenInputMeshes.py # Helper script to automatically generate mesh names from Bodyslide SliderSet folders for input

├── GenerateModFromInputs.py # Main script to run the generation process

├── maps.yaml                # Yaml config to determine bodyslots, keywords and armor value mapping

├── inputs.yaml              # Yaml file to specify the inputs for each clothing piece of the mod

├── templates.py             # Contains text templates for esp record types

└── README.md                # This documentation file[/code]

7318624395313.name: Gunslicer Sneak Animations - My Version
7318624395313.summary: My version of Gunslicer's sneak animations with neck and back adjusted to look more natural, formatted for OAR
7318624395313.description:
I made some edits to [Gunslicer's sneak animations](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/61159). Because Skyrim's simplistic skeleton rig is not very good, the original animation's neck shape is very screwed up. See comparison photo.

In light of this, I adjusted the neck position. I made adjustments to the spine as well since I thought the original animation's spine/back was too flat, this also helped with the neck position, overall I think it looks less unnatural.

I only adjusted sneakmtidle, sneakrun_forward, and sneakwalk_forward since I use true directional movement and the other animations don't get called. If you don't use true directional movement you will get the original animations when you move in other directions.

The animations are in OAR format, which means you will need it for this to work. The trigger conditions are female player character with weapons sheathed. 

I also threw in an alternate squat idle that I made that will be randomly chosen alongside Gunslicer's idle, you can delete the sneakmtidle2.hkx file if you don't like it.

Also added a height adjustment slider to earrings bodyslide.

You will need the original mod.

7318624386826.name: Bodyslide Ground Mesh Generator
7318624386826.summary: Python automation script for converting bodyslide .nif mesh files to ground meshes for armor/clothing mods.
7318624386826.description:
Bodyslide Ground Mesh Generator

The Bodyslide Ground Mesh Generator is an automation tool for the process of generating ground (GND) mesh files for armor/clothing mods. Using Outfit Studio and Python's pywinauto library, this script automates the task of importing, modifying, and exporting .nif files. I am lazy and creating all of the ground meshes manually is incredibly time consuming and boring, so I came up with this solution instead since using vanilla ground meshes looks bad and not using ground meshes also creates problems. 

The default movements to put meshes flat against the floor work the best with meshes covering the upper body, and it tries to avoid adjusting shoes/boots meshes by mesh name filtering. This won't be perfect but it will automate most of the annoying work, giving you a minimally viable ground mesh to further adjust or just use as is. Hopefully this saves other people some time!

This includs a config.json for you to point references/filepaths to custom locations, although the default setup will work out of the box.

Prerequisites

Before you begin, ensure you have met the following requirements:

* Python 3.6 or newer installed on your machine.

* The pywinauto Python library for automating the Outfit Studio GUI tasks. (I used pywinauto 0.6.8)

* Basic knowledge of programming/scripting for modding.

Installation

Python Installation

If you don't have Python installed, download the latest Python version from [the official website](https://www.python.org/downloads/).

Installing pywinauto

To install pywinauto, open your command prompt or terminal and run the following command:

[code]pip install -r requirements.txt[/code]

Configuration

Before running the script, you need to adjust several file paths according to your environment and needs:

* **OUTFITSTUDIO_DIR**: Path to your Outfit Studio executable. (defaults to using the 32-bit executable, should probably also work on x64)

* **GND_REF_PATH**: Path to the ground reference .nif file. (a default rectangle mesh is included)

* **CONVERTING_MESHES_DIR**: Directory containing .nif files to be converted. (the default meshes/to_convert included here will work)

* **FINISHED_GND_MESHES_DIR**: Output directory for the processed .nif files. (defaults to meshes/output)

These paths can be set in the config.json file, for which a default config is located in the same directory as the script. Here's an example for the default structure of config.json:

[code]{

  "OUTFITSTUDIO_DIR": "D:\\MO2\\Mods\\BodySlide and Outfit Studio\\CalienteTools\\BodySlide\\OutfitStudio.exe",

  "GND_REF_PATH": "meshes\\gnd_ref\\gnd_ref.nif",

  "CONVERTING_MESHES_DIR": "meshes\\to_convert\\",

  "FINISHED_GND_MESHES_DIR": "meshes\\output\\"

}

[/code]

There are two other json properties that indicate which base shape mesh names to delete, and which names likely indicate footwear meshes and should not be moved down. You can also adjust these if you want.

Adjust the paths in the config.json file to match your setup.

Using the Script

Grab the mesh .nif files that you want to turn into ground meshes and drop them in the meshes/to_convert folder (or somewhere else specified in config.json)

To run the script, follow these steps:

[list=1]

* Open a powershell prompt or terminal.

* Navigate to the directory containing the script.

* Run the script using Python:

[code]python BS_gnd_meshgen.py[/code]

Alternatively, you can also run this in a Jupyter Notebook, whichever you prefer.

Once it starts, let Python automate through Outfit Studio. Don't touch it, go take a walk. Once it's done, the files will be in meshes/output (or wherever you pointed them)

Additional Information

Ensure you are using copies of your .nif mesh files before running the script, as it will delete them from the meshes/to_convert folder after the ground meshes have been generated.

This script assumes familiarity with basic Python and command-line usage. If you're new to Python, consider going through introductory tutorials first.

License

MIT License

Misc Credits

This description was converted from markdown with [md2nexus](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/100441) by ceejbot. Thanks!

7318624386450.name: Dynamic Random Female Idles OAR Idles Organizer Utility
7318624386450.summary: Tool to rename and organize custom .hkx animation files for Dynamic Random Female Idles OAR version. Prebuilt executables for Windows.
7318624386450.description:
Dynamic Random Female Idles OAR Idles Organizer Helper Utility

This tool automatically renames and organizes .hkx animation files into the Dynamic Random Female Idles OAR file structure ("Meshes\\Actors\\Character\\Animations\\OpenAnimationReplacer\\DynamicRandomFemaleIdles\\{ID}\\female\\"), making it easier to add your own idles or overwrite the existing ones. It provides functionality similar to the GenerateIdles.jar script in the DAR version, where you supplied your own idle animations. This also generates the json configs for OAR.

There are two variants of the script, one of which creates a submod for each animation for random animations, and the other makes use of the new animation variants structure since OAR 1.2.0 and uses the "_variants_mt_idle" folder for idle anim variation. You can pick whichever one you prefer, but you'll probably want to delete the other idle anim submods if you use the variant structure.

Features

* Automatically renames .hkx and .HKX files to mt_idle.hkx (in the submod version; in the variants version, the filename is kept).

* Organizes files into a directory structure starting from 4096/female/mt_idle.hkx.

* Copies files without deleting the original ones.

* Cross-platform compatibility (Windows, macOS, Linux).

* Simple GUI for indicating completion.

Requirements (if you're not using a prebuilt executable)

* Rust and Cargo installed on your system for compiling the source code.

Compilation

To compile the tool from source, navigate to the project directory in your terminal and run:

[code]

cargo build --release --all-targets

[/code]

The compiled executable will be located in target/release/.

Usage

Place the (pre)compiled executable or source Rust files in the same directory as your idle animation .hkx files.

Your idle animation files will be automatically renamed and organized. A pop up will notify you when it finishes. Drop the resulting meshes folder into the directory of your Dynamic Random Female Idles V2 installation to replace them.

Optionally, delete the submods containing the idle animations that you don't want.

License

This project is licensed under the MIT License.

Misc Complaints

Previously released as a Python script/executable but Nexus and Virustotal got mad at the files because executables packed from Python scripts get flagged as false positives. Executable now prebuilt with Rust 1.76.0 on a Windows runner CI/CD pipeline on Github Actions and hopefully doesn't trigger false positives.

Misc Credits

This description was converted from markdown with [md2nexus ](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/100441)by ceejbot. Thanks!

7318624386449.name: Bodyslide Preset Scaler Utility
7318624386449.summary: Tool for scaling Bodyslide presets. Quickly adjust preset values at weight 0 and 100 based on specified input factors. Prebuilt executable for Windows
7318624386449.description:
Bodyslide Preset Scaler Utility

An application for scaling Bodyslide presets. Quickly adjust preset values at weight 0 and 100 based on specified factors. This is for when you think some preset at 57 weight or something looks good and you want that as a new preset scaled to weight 100. You can also go crazy with it and find out what things look like at 500% if you want to.

Features

* **Factor Adjustment**: Modify preset slider values using user input factors at weight 0 and weight 100.

* **GUI**: Easy to use executable to input factor values, file paths, and new preset names.

Usage

[list=1]

* **Input Factor Values**: Enter the scaling factors for sliders as ratios where 0.5 means 50% and 2 means 200% and so on.

* **Select Input File**: Click on the Browse button to choose the XML file containing the Bodyslide preset.

* **Specify Output File**: Click on the Save As button to designate the file path and name for the modified preset.

* **Optional Preset Name**: Optionally provide a new name for the preset.

* **Run**: Click the Run button. The status message will indicate when the process is complete.

Installation

If you don't want to build this from source (probably most of you), prebuilt executable for Windows built using Rust 1.76.0 is available for download.

If you think my build environment is sus or you are on Linux, follow the steps below:

[list=1]

* Ensure you have Rust installed on your system. If not, follow the instructions [here](https://www.rust-lang.org/tools/install).

* Download the source code to your local machine.

* Navigate to the project directory.

* Run the following command to build:

[code]cargo build --release[/code]

Dependencies

* **serde**

* **rfd**

* **druid**

* **quick-xml**

License

This project is licensed under the MIT License.

Misc Credits

This description was converted from markdown with [md2nexus ](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/100441)by ceejbot. Thanks!

Dress from Papergame's Shine. Original Oldrim UNP port by Hezimao on [9dm](http://www.9dmsgame.net/thread-180161-1-1.html), converted to CBBE 3BA with additional color variants added. 

Comes in six colors (black, white, red, pink, yellow, blue).

esl flagged esp. Build with bodyslide, use some kind of additemmenu mod. You'll also want a SMP implementation.

You will need [extended esl support](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/106441) if your game version is below 1.6.1130

7318624383443.name: Bisquits Pain Bringer
7318624383443.summary: Oblivion outfit originally by bisquits now converted for SSE CBBE 3BA bodyslide. Upscaled texture and color variant.
7318624383443.description:
[bisquit's Oblivion Pain Bringer armor ](https://www.nexusmods.com/oblivion/mods/16838)set converted for CBBE 3BA Bodyslide. 

I upscaled the texture, increased mesh vertex count, and added a silver color variant. I also split up the pieces so top and bottom can be separated.

esl flagged esp. Build with bodyslide and use additemmenu.

You will need [extended esl support](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/106441) if you're below 1.6.1130

![Image](https://files.catbox.moe/q1t6kx.gif)

7318624383372.name: Hezimao 42 Dress
7318624383372.summary: See-through short dress. CBBE 3BA and BHUNP Bodyslide
7318624383372.description:
See-through short dress in three colors. [Oldrim UNP mod ](http://www.9dmsgame.com/thread-174655-1-4.html)by Hezimao, [converted to CBBE ](https://www.loverslab.com/topic/24385-outfit-studiobodyslide-2-cbbe-conversions/?do=findComment&comment=2758509)by Sorceress99 on Loverslab. 

Converted to CBBE 3BA and BHUNP with additional color variants added. Comes in three colors (black, white, red). 

esl flagged esp. Build using bodyslide, and use additemmenu.

7318624383368.name: ProType Summertime Dress
7318624383368.summary: ProType Summertime Dress from Oblivion converted to CBBE 3BA with SMP skirt. Four colors and transparency options.
7318624383368.description:
ProType Summertime Dress from Oblivion, originally converted to Oldrim CBBE by Sorceress99 from Loverslab, converted here to SSE CBBE 3BA with texture upscaled to 4k and optional SMP for the skirt.

Dress with four colors and transparency options, and panty in black or white. esl flagged esp, build with bodyslide and use additemmenu.

You will need [extended esl support](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/106441) if you're below 1.6.1130

7318624383360.name: Speed Buster Ofuda
7318624383360.summary: 2 sets of 4 Ofuda "armor" variants. CBBE 3BA Bodyslide.
7318624383360.description:
An ofuda is a blessed cloth talisman, so this will protect you against evil, right?

[Original Oblivion mod ](https://www.nexusmods.com/oblivion/mods/22912?tab=description)from Speed Buster, converted to [Oldrim UNPB ](https://www.loverslab.com/files/file/2048-spb-ofuda-for-unp-jiggle/)by asenasen. This is a CBBE 3BA conversion with texture upscaling.

esl flagged esp. Build with bodyslide and use additemmenu or some similar mod.

You will need [extended esl support](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/106441) if your game version is below 1.6.1130

7318624383359.summary: Chinese dudou/undershirt and panty. 3 colors/4 texture variants. For CBBE 3BA/BHUNP. esl flagged esp.
7318624383359.description:
4 pieces of Chinese dudou/undershirt and panty. Original Oldrim mod by Heimu. Converted to SSE for CBBE 3BA  (and BHUNP, but it's untested) bodyslide and texture upscaled to 4k. Comes in whole outfit/top/panty options. I also added black and white variants. 

esl flagged esp. Use some kind of additemmenu mod.

You will need [extended esl support](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/106441) if you're below 1.6.1130

7318624383307.name: Blade and Soul Pure White
7318624383307.summary: Pure White Set from Blade and Soul, two tops, three panties, two heels, choker, tie, necklace, thigh and calf band. CBBE 3BA Bodyslide.
7318624383307.description:
Pure White Set from Blade and Soul, originally converted to Skyrim by [Outlawer's workshop](https://www.patreon.com/posts/bns-purewhite-30362586). Two shirt variants (with or without bra), three neck accessories (necktie, necklace, choker), three underwear variants (slot 49), two leg accessories (slot 53), and two heel varieties.

I made the 3BA conversion, upscaled textures to 4k, added bodyslide files for the pieces not in the original, and made some esp edits.

esl flagged esp.

7318624383288.name: Foxmiko Rurosakura Kimono Xing
7318624383288.summary: Two kimono outfits with whole outfit variants or parts and some accessories.
7318624383288.description:
Includes two kimonos with SMP parts each with whole outfit variant and parts (top, skirt, band, clogs, bra/panties), and accessories (ear, tail, SMP earrings). Requires heels sounds and Faster SMP.

[Original BHUNP version by Xing](https://www.patreon.com/posts/se-foxmiko-xing-40794933), upscaled to 2k/4k and converted to CBBE 3BA with additional color variants (black, gray, white, yellow, blue) and BS zap.

Bone weights for the SMP parts might be kind of janky because I did it by hand and didn't do a good job.

7318624383274.name: Sexy Elves Outfit
7318624383274.summary: CBBE 3BA outfit, two variations and comes in gold or silver. Optional SMP physics for cloth
7318624383274.description:
Oblivion outfit mod converted to SSE for CBBE 3BA, I added gold variants and 5 gem color versions for the bracelets, separated the mesh into separate armor pieces and accessories, and added SMP for the cloth pieces.

ESL flagged esp. Build with bodyslide and use AIM. Screenshots welcome.

You will need [extended esl support](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/106441) if you're below 1.6.1130. You will also need [FSMP ](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/57339)for the SMP version.

For BHUNP users, there is [another conversion ](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/114122)by [hyruledm](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/users/94893323)

7318624364783.name: Elegant Jewelry - SE CBBE 3BA Bodyslide
7318624364783.summary: Add 3BA bodyslide files for zzjay's elegant jewelry mod
7318624364783.description: Since the original mod was based on UNP, the armlet doesn't match up with CBBE body. This fixes that with bodyslide for it. I also did the necklace as well. Requires original mod: https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/91656

7318624428395.name: Yurica Summer Dress
7318624428395.summary: Yurica summer dress set in two colors for CBBE 3BA and BHUNPv4 with SMP skirt
7318624428395.description:
This is a conversion of yurica's [summer dress set ](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/65777)from Oldrim. I also added SMP to the skirts and the bow ribbons. The heels also now use NiOverride.

There are three shapes of white dresses that have black or blue highlights; the accessories like hats and heels also are in black or blue. There's also two bracelets.

esl flagged esp. Use [additemmenu](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/17563), [modex](https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/137877), or [console](https://elderscrolls.fandom.com/wiki/Console_Commands_(Skyrim)); no crafting recipes. [Build with bodyslide ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=45E8qqnqJDQ)first.

Requirements:

CBBE 3BA or BHUNPv4

Bodyslide

FSMP﻿

Racemenu

Screenshots:

[nuuwei](https://x.com/NuuweiNoir)

[myst](https://x.com/Myst314)﻿

 ![Image](https://i.imgur.com/NAEELTf.png)
